description: An XSD file stores its contents as plain text in XML format, which means the files can be opened and viewed by any text editor and numerous other programs. However, if you want to edit an XSD file, you should use an XML editor, such as Microsoft XML Notepad, Bare Bones BBEdit, or SyncRO Soft oXygen XML Editor.
NOTE: XSD files may be used as an alternative to Document Type Definition ( .DTD ) files for defining XML schemas.
